Name: BindableFunction
Summary: Allow functions defined in one script to be called by another script

Members.Name: Invoke
Members.Summary: Causes the function assigned to OnInvoke to be called. Arguments passed to this function get passed to OnInvoke function.

Members.Name: OnInvoke
Members.Summary: Should be defined as a function. This function is called when Invoke() is called. Number of arguments is variable.

Name: BindableEvent
Summary: Allow events defined in one script to be subscribed to by another script

Members.Name: Fire
Members.Summary: Used to make the custom event fire (see Event for more info). Arguments can be variable length.

Members.Name: Event
Members.Summary: This event fires when the Fire() method is used.  Receives the variable length arguments from Fire().

Name: TouchTransmitter
Summary: Used by networking and replication code to transmit touch events - no other purpose

Name: ForceField
Summary: Prevents joint breakage from explosions, and stops Humanoids from taking damage

Name: TeleportService
Summary: Allows players to seamlessly leave a game and join another

Name: AssetService
Summary: A service used to set and get information about assets stored on the Roblox website.

Members.Name: RevertAsset
Members.Summary: Reverts a given place id to the version number provided. Returns true if successful on reverting, false otherwise.

Members.Name: SetPlacePermissions
Members.Summary: Sets the permissions for a placeID to the place accessType. An optional table (inviteList) can be included that will set the accessType for only the player names provided. The table should be set up as an array of usernames (strings).

Members.Name: GetPlacePermissions
Members.Summary: Given a placeID, this function will return a table with the permissions of the place. Useful for determining what kind of permissions a particular user may have for a place.

Members.Name: GetAssetVersions
Members.Summary: Given a placeID, this function will return a table with the version info of the place. An optional arg of page number can be used to page through all revisions (a single page may hold about 50 revisions).

Members.Name: GetCreatorAssetID
Members.Summary: Given a creationID, this function will return the asset that created the creationID. If no other asset created the given creationID, 0 is returned.

Members.Name: HttpEnabled
Members.Summary: Enabling http requests from scripts

Name: InsertService
Summary: A service used to insert objects stored on the website into the game.

Members.Name: GetCollection
Members.Summary: Returns a table for the assets stored in the category. A category is an setId from www.roblox.com that links to a set. More info on table format. More info on sets

Members.Name: Insert
Members.Summary: Inserts the Instance into the workspace.  It is recommended to use Instance.Parent = game.Workspace instead, as this can cause issues currently.

Members.Name: ApproveAssetId
Members.Summary: Deprecated

Members.Name: ApproveAssetVersionId
Members.Summary: Deprecated

Members.Name: GetBaseSets
Members.Summary: Returns a table containing a list of the various setIds that are ROBLOX approved. More info on sets

Members.Name: GetUserSets
Members.Summary: Returns a table containing a list of the various setIds that correspond to argument 'userId'. More info on sets

Members.Name: GetBaseCategories
Members.Summary: Deprecated. Use GetBaseSets() instead.

Members.Name: GetUserCategories
Members.Summary: Deprecated. Use GetUserSets() instead.

Members.Name: LoadAsset
Members.Summary: Returns a Model containing the Instance that resides at AssetId on the web. This call will also yield the script until the model is returned. Script execution can still continue, however, if you use a coroutine.

Members.Name: LoadAssetVersion
Members.Summary: Similar to LoadAsset, but instead an AssetVersionId is passed in, which refers to a particular version of the asset which is not neccessarily the latest version.

Name: Mouse
Summary: Used to receive input from the user. Actually tracks mouse events and keyboard events.

Members.Name: Hit
Members.Summary: The CoordinateFrame of where the Mouse ray is currently hitting a 3D object in the Workspace.  If the mouse is not over any 3D objects in the Workspace, this property is nil.

Members.Name: Icon
Members.Summary: The current Texture of the Mouse Icon. Stored as a string, for more information on how to format the string go here

Members.Name: Origin
Members.Summary: The CoordinateFrame of where the Mouse is when the mouse is not clicking.

Members.Name: Origin
Members.Summary: The CoordinateFrame of where the Mouse is when the mouse is not clicking.  This CoordinateFrame will be very close to the Camera.CoordinateFrame.

Members.Name: Target
Members.Summary: The Part the mouse is currently over. If the mouse is not currently over any object (on the skybox, for example) this property is nil.

Members.Name: TargetFilter
Members.Summary: A Part or Model that the Mouse will ignore when trying to find the Target, TargetSurface and Hit.

Members.Name: TargetSurface
Members.Summary: The NormalId (Top, Left, Down, etc.) of the face of the part the Mouse is currently over.

Members.Name: UnitRay
Members.Summary: The Unit Ray from where the mouse is (Origin) to the current Mouse.Target.

Members.Name: ViewSizeX
Members.Summary: The viewport's (game window) width in pixels.

Members.Name: ViewSizeY
Members.Summary: The viewport's (game window) height in pixels.

Members.Name: X
Members.Summary: The absolute pixel position of the Mouse along the x-axis of the viewport (game window). Values start at 0 on the left hand side of the screen and increase to the right.

Members.Name: Y
Members.Summary: The absolute pixel position of the Mouse along the y-axis of the viewport (game window). Values start at 0 on the stop of the screen and increase to the bottom.

Members.Name: Button1Down
Members.Summary: Fired when the first button (usually the left, but could be another) on the mouse is depressed.

Members.Name: Button1Up
Members.Summary: Fired when the first button (usually the left, but could be another) on the mouse is release.

Members.Name: Button2Down
Members.Summary: This event is currently non-operational.

Members.Name: Button2Up
Members.Summary: This event is currently non-operational.

Members.Name: Idle
Members.Summary: Fired constantly when the mouse is not firing any other event (i.e. the mouse isn't moving, nor any buttons being pressed or depressed).

Members.Name: KeyDown
Members.Summary: Fired when a user presses a key on the keyboard. Argument is a string representation of the key.  If the key has no string representation (such as space), the string passed in is the keycode for that character. Keycodes are currently in ASCII.

Members.Name: KeyUp
Members.Summary: Fired when a user releases a key on the keyboard. Argument is a string representation of the key.  If the key has no string representation (such as space), the string passed in is the keycode for that character. Keycodes are currently in ASCII.

Members.Name: Move
Members.Summary: Fired when the mouse X or Y member changes.

Members.Name: WheelBackward
Members.Summary: This event is currently non-operational.

Members.Name: WheelForward
Members.Summary: This event is currently non-operational.

Members.Name: SetThreadShare
Members.Summary: Deprecated

Name: ClickDetector
Summary: Raises mouse events for parent object

Members.Name: MaxActivationDistance
Members.Summary: The maximum distance a Player's character can be from the ClickDetector's parent Part that will allow the Player's mouse to fire events on this object.

Members.Name: MouseClick
Members.Summary: Fired when a player clicks on the parent Part of ClickDetector. The argument provided is always of type Player.

Members.Name: MouseHoverEnter
Members.Summary: Fired when a player's mouse enters on the parent Part of ClickDetector. The argument provided is always of type Player.

Members.Name: MouseHoverLeave
Members.Summary: Fired when a player's mouse leaves the parent Part of ClickDetector. The argument provided is always of type Player.

Name: Smoke
Summary: Makes the parent part or model object emit smoke

Name: Sparkles
Summary: Makes the parent part or model object fantastic

Name: Explosion
Summary: Creates an Explosion! This can be used as a purely graphical effect, or can be made to damage objects.

Members.Name: BlastPressure
Members.Summary: How much force this Explosion exerts on objects within it's BlastRadius. Setting this to 0 creates a purely graphical effect. A larger number will cause Parts to fly away at higher velocities.

Members.Name: BlastRadius
Members.Summary: How big the Explosion is. This is a circle starting from the center of the Explosion's Position, the larger this property the larger the circle of destruction.

Members.Name: Position
Members.Summary: Where the Explosion occurs in absolute world coordinates.

Members.Name: ExplosionType
Members.Summary: Defines the behavior of the Explosion. More info

Name: Fire
Summary: Makes the parent part or model object emit fire

Members.Name: Color
Members.Summary: The color of the base of the fire.  See SecondaryColor for more.

Members.Name: Heat
Members.Summary: How hot the fire appears to be. The flame moves quicker the higher this value is set.

Members.Name: SecondaryColor
Members.Summary: The color the fire interpolates to from Color. The longer a particle exists in the fire, the close to this color it becomes.

Members.Name: Size
Members.Summary: How large the fire appears to be.

Name: Platform
Summary: Equivalent to a seat, except that the character stands up rather than sits down.

Name: VehicleSeat
Summary: Automatically finds and powers hinge joints in an assembly.  Ignores motors.

Members.Name: CanBeDropped
Members.Summary: If someone is carrying this flag, this bool determines whether or not they can drop it and run.

Members.Name: TeamColor
Members.Summary: The Team this flag is for. Corresponds with the TeamColors in the Teams service.

Name: Decal
Summary: Descibes a texture that is placed on one of the sides of the Part it is parented to.

Members.Name: Face
Members.Summary: Describes the face of the Part the decal will be applied to. More info

Members.Name: Shiny
Members.Summary: How much light will appear to reflect off of the decal.

Members.Name: Specular
Members.Summary: How light will react to the surface of the decal.

Members.Name: Transparency
Members.Summary: How visible the decal is.  1 is completely invisible, while 0 is completely opaque

Name: IntValue
Summary: Stores a int value in it's Value member. Useful to share int information across multiple scripts.

Name: RayValue
Summary: Stores a Ray value in it's Value member. Useful to share Ray information across multiple scripts.

Name: IntConstrainedValue
Summary: Stores an int value in it's Value member.  Value is clamped to be in range of Min and MaxValue. Useful to share int information across multiple scripts.

Name: DoubleConstrainedValue
Summary: Stores a double value in it's Value member.  Value is clamped to be in range of Min and MaxValue. Useful to share double information across multiple scripts.

Members.Name: MaxValue
Members.Summary: The maximum we allow this Value to be set.  If Value is set higher than this, it automatically gets adjusted to MaxValue

Members.Name: MinValue
Members.Summary: The minimum we allow this Value to be set.  If Value is set lower than this, it automatically gets adjusted to MinValue

Name: BoolValue
Summary: Stores a boolean value in it's Value member. Useful to share boolean information across multiple scripts.

Name: FloorWire
Summary: Renders a thin cylinder than can be adorned with textures that 'flow' from one object to the next. Has basic pathing abilities and attempts to to not intersect anything. More info

Members.Name: CycleOffset
Members.Summary: Controls how the decals are positioned along the wire. More info

Members.Name: From
Members.Summary: The object the FloorWire 'emits' from

Members.Name: StudsBetweenTextures
Members.Summary: The space between two textures on the wire. Note: studs are relative depending on how far the camera is from the FloorWire.

Members.Name: Texture
Members.Summary: The image we use to render the textures that flow from beginning to end of the FloorWire.

Members.Name: TextureSize
Members.Summary: The size in studs of the Texture we use to flow from one object to the next.

Members.Name: To
Members.Summary: The object the FloorWire 'emits' to

Members.Name: Velocity
Members.Summary: The rate of travel that the textures flow along the wire.

Members.Name: WireRadius
Members.Summary: How thick the wire is.

Name: CFrameValue
Summary: Stores a CFrame value in it's Value member. Useful to share CFrame information across multiple scripts.

Name: Color3Value
Summary: Stores a Color3 value in it's Value member. Useful to share Color3 information across multiple scripts.

Name: BrickColorValue
Summary: Stores a BrickColor value in it's Value member. Useful to share BrickColor information across multiple scripts.

Members.Name: play
Members.Summary: Deprecated. Use Play() instead

Members.Name: PlayOnRemove
Members.Summary: The sound will play when it is removed from the Workspace. Looped sounds don't play

Members.Name: AmbientReverb
Members.Summary: The ambient sound environment.  May not work when using hardware sound

Members.Name: DopplerScale
Members.Summary: The doppler scale is a general scaling factor for how much the pitch varies due to doppler shifting in 3D sound. Doppler is the pitch bending effect when a sound comes towards the listener or moves away from it, much like the effect you hear when a train goes past you with its horn sounding. With dopplerscale you can exaggerate or diminish the effect.

Members.Name: DistanceFactor
Members.Summary: the relative distance factor, compared to 1.0 meters.

Members.Name: RolloffScale
Members.Summary: Setting this value makes the sound drop off faster or slower. The higher the value, the faster volume will attenuate, and conversely the lower the value, the slower it will attenuate. For example a rolloff factor of 1 will simulate the real world, where as a value of 2 will make sounds attenuate 2 times quicker.

Members.Name: PromptPurchase
Members.Summary: Will prompt 'player' to purchase the item associated with 'assetId'.  'equipIfPurchased' is an optional argument that will give the item to the player immediately if they buy it (only applies to gear).  'currencyType' is also optional and will attempt to prompt the user with a specified currency if the product can be purchased with this currency, otherwise we use the default currency of the product.

Members.Name: GetProductInfo
Members.Summary: Takes one argument "assetId" which should be a number of an asset on www.roblox.com.  Returns a table containing the product information (if this process fails, returns an empty table).

Members.Name: PromptPurchaseFinished
Members.Summary: Fired when a 'player' dismisses a purchase dialog for 'assetId'.  If the player purchased the item 'isPurchased' will be true, otherwise it will be false. This call will produce a warning if called on a guest player.

Members.Name: MoveTo
Members.Summary: Attempts to move the Humanoid and it's associated character to 'part'. 'location' is used as an offset from part's origin.

Members.Name: TakeDamage
Members.Summary: Decreases health by the amount.  Use this instead of changing health directly to make sure weapons are filtered for things such as ForceField(s).

Members.Name: UnequipTools
Members.Summary: Takes any active gear/tools that the Humanoid is using and puts them into the backpack.  This function only works on Humanoids with a corresponding Player.

Members.Name: EquipTool
Members.Summary: Takes a specified tool and equips it to the Humanoid's Character.  Tool argument should be of type 'Tool'.

Members.Name: NameOcclusion
Members.Summary: Sets how to display other humanoid names to this humanoid's player. More info

Members.Name: CoordinateFrame
Members.Summary: Deprecated. Use CFrame instead

Members.Name: service
Members.Summary: Use GetService() instead

Name: Hopper
Summary: Use StarterPack instead

Members.Name: Archivable
Members.Summary: Determines whether or not an Instance can be saved when the game closes/attempts to save the game. Note: this only applies to games that use Data Persistence, or Personal Build Servers.

Members.Name: ClassName
Members.Summary: The string name of this Instance's most derived class.

Members.Name: Parent
Members.Summary: The Instance that is directly above this Instance in the tree.

Members.Name: GetDebugId
Members.Summary: This function is for internal testing. Don't use in production code

Members.Name: Clone
Members.Summary: Returns a copy of this Object and all its children. The copy's Parent is nil

Members.Name: clone
Members.Summary: Use Clone() instead

Members.Name: isA
Members.Summary: Use IsA() instead

Members.Name: IsA
Members.Summary: Returns a boolean if this Instance is of type 'className' or a is a subclass of type 'className'. If 'className' is not a valid class type in ROBLOX, this function will always return false. More info

Members.Name: FindFirstChild
Members.Summary: Returns the first child of this Instance that matches the first argument 'name'.  The second argument 'recursive' is an optional boolean (defaults to false) that will force the call to traverse down thru all of this Instance's descendants until it finds an object with a name that matches the 'name' argument.  The function will return nil if no Instance is found.

Members.Name: GetFullName
Members.Summary: Returns a string that shows the path from the root node (DataModel) to this Instance.  This string does not include the root node (DataModel).

Members.Name: children
Members.Summary: Use GetChildren() instead

Members.Name: getChildren
Members.Summary: Use GetChildren() instead

Members.Name: GetChildren
Members.Summary: Returns a read-only table of this Object's children

Members.Name: Remove
Members.Summary: Deprecated. Use ClearAllChildren() to get rid of all child objects, or Destroy() to invalidate this object and its descendants

Members.Name: remove
Members.Summary: Use Remove() instead

Members.Name: ClearAllChildren
Members.Summary: Removes all children (but not this object) from the workspace.

Members.Name: Destroy
Members.Summary: Removes object and all of its children from the workspace. Disconnects object and all children from open connections. Object and children may not be usable after calling Destroy.

Members.Name: findFirstChild
Members.Summary: Use FindFirstChild() instead

Members.Name: AncestryChanged
Members.Summary: Fired when any of this object's ancestors change.  First argument 'child' is the object whose parent changed.  Second argument 'parent' is the first argument's new parent.

Members.Name: DescendantAdded
Members.Summary: Fired after an Instance is parented to this object, or any of this object's descendants.  The 'descendant' argument is the Instance that is being added.

Members.Name: DescendantRemoving
Members.Summary: Fired after an Instance is unparented from this object, or any of this object's descendants.  The 'descendant' argument is the Instance that is being added.

Members.Name: Changed
Members.Summary: Fired after a property changes value.  The property argument is the name of the property

Name: BodyGyro
Summary: Attempts to maintain a fixed orientation of its parent Part

Members.Name: maxTorque
Members.Summary: The maximum torque that will be exerted on the Part

Members.Name: D
Members.Summary: The dampening factor applied to this force

Members.Name: P
Members.Summary: The power continually applied to this force

Members.Name: cframe
Members.Summary: the cframe that this force is trying to orient its parent Part to.  Note: this force only uses the rotation of the cframe, not the position.

Members.Name: maxForce
Members.Summary: The maximum force that will be exerted on the Part

Members.Name: D
Members.Summary: The dampening factor applied to this force

Members.Name: P
Members.Summary: The power factor continually applied to this force

Members.Name: position
Members.Summary: The Vector3 that this force is trying to position its parent Part to.

Name: RocketPropulsion
Summary: A propulsion system that mimics a rocket

Members.Name: maxForce
Members.Summary: The maximum force that will be exerted on the Part in each axis

Members.Name: P
Members.Summary: The amount of power we add to the system.  The higher the power, the quicker the force will achieve its goal.

Members.Name: velocity
Members.Summary: The velocity this system tries to achieve.  How quickly the system reaches this velocity (if ever) is defined by P.

Name: BodyForce
Summary: When parented to a physical part, BodyForce will continually exert a force upon its parent object.

Members.Name: force
Members.Summary: The power continually applied to this force

Members.Name: location
Members.Summary: The Vector3 location of where to apply the force to.

Name: Teams
Summary: This Service-level object is the container for all Team objects in a level. A map that supports team games must have a Teams service. More info

Name: Team
Summary: The Team class is used to represent a faction in a team game. The only valid location for a Team object is under the Teams service. More info

Members.Name: LinkedScript
Members.Summary: This property is under development. Do not use

Name: LocalScript
Summary: A script that runs on clients, NOT servers.  LocalScripts can only run when parented under the PlayerGui currently.

Name: Model
Summary: A construct used to group Parts and other objects together

Members.Name: BreakJoints
Members.Summary: Breaks all surface joints contained within

Members.Name: GetModelCFrame
Members.Summary: Returns a CFrame that has position of the centroid of all Parts in the Model.  The rotation matrix is either the rotation matrix of the user-defined PrimaryPart, or if not specified then  a part in the Model chosen by the engine.

Members.Name: GetModelSize
Members.Summary: Returns a Vector3 that is union of the extents of all Parts in the model.

Members.Name: MakeJoints
Members.Summary: Creates the appropriate SurfaceJoints between all touching Parts contrained within the model. Technically, this function calls MakeJoints() on all Parts inside the model.

Members.Name: MoveTo
Members.Summary: Moves the centroid of the Model to the specified location, respecting all relative distances between parts in the model.

Members.Name: ResetOrientationToIdentity
Members.Summary: Rotates all parts in the model to the orientation that was set using SetIdentityOrientation().  If this function has never been called, rotation is reset to GetModelCFrame()'s rotation.

Members.Name: SetIdentityOrientation
Members.Summary: Takes the current rotation matrix of the model and stores it as the model's identity matrix. The rotation is applied when ResetOrientationToIdentity() is called.

Members.Name: TranslateBy
Members.Summary: Similar to MoveTo(), except instead of moving to an explicit location, we use the model's current CFrame location and offset it.

Members.Name: makeJoints
Members.Summary: Use MakeJoints() instead

Members.Name: move
Members.Summary: Use MoveTo() instead

Members.Name: PrimaryPart
Members.Summary: Used to help calculate the Model's CFrame rotation. If this is never assigned to, the engine automatically designates a PrimaryPart to figure out rotations.

Members.Name: move
Members.Summary: Use MoveTo() instead

Members.Name: workspace
Members.Summary: Deprecated. Use Workspace

Members.Name: ShowMouse
Members.Summary: Deprecated. Use Workspace.IsMouseCursorVisible

Members.Name: IsLoaded
Members.Summary: Returns true if the game has finished loading, false otherwise.  Check this before listening to the Loaded signal to ensure a script knows when a game finishes loading.

Members.Name: Loaded
Members.Summary: Fires when the game finishes loading.  Use this to know when to remove your custom loading gui.  It is best to check IsLoaded() before connecting to this event, as the game may load before the event is connected to.

Members.Name: get
Members.Summary: Use GetObjects() instead

Members.Name: SetPlaceID
Members.Summary: Use SetPlaceId() instead

Members.Name: SetCreatorID
Members.Summary: Use SetCreatorId() instead

Members.Name: CameraSubject
Members.Summary: Where the Camera's focus is.  Any rotation of the camera will be about this subject.

Members.Name: CameraType
Members.Summary: Defines how the camera will behave. More info

Members.Name: CoordinateFrame
Members.Summary: The current position and rotation of the Camera.  For most CameraTypes, the rotation is set such that the CoordinateFrame lookVector is pointing at the Focus.

Members.Name: FieldOfView
Members.Summary: The current angle, or width, of what the camera can see.  Current acceptable values are from 20 degrees to 80.

Members.Name: Focus
Members.Summary: The current CoordinateFrame that the camera is looking at.  Note: it is not always guaranteed that the camera is always looking here.

Members.Name: GetRoll
Members.Summary: Returns the camera's current roll. Roll is defined in radians, and is stored as the delta from the camera's y axis default normal vector.

Members.Name: SetRoll
Members.Summary: Sets the camera's current roll. Roll is defined in radians, and is stored as the delta from the camera's y axis default normal vector.

Members.Name: CharacterAutoLoads
Members.Summary: Set to true, when a player joins a game, they get a character automatically, as well as when they die.  When set to false, characters do not auto load and will only load in using Player:LoadCharacter().

Members.Name: players
Members.Summary: Use GetPlayers() instead

Name: ReplicatedStorage
Summary: A container whose contents are replicated to all clients and the server.

Name: ServerStorage
Summary: A container whose contents are only on the server.

Name: ServerScriptService
Summary: A container whose contents should be scripts. Scripts that are added to the container are run on the server.

Name: Lighting
Summary: Responsible for all lighting aspects of the world (affects how things are rendered).

Members.Name: GetMinutesAfterMidnight
Members.Summary: The number of minutes that the current time is past midnight.  If currently at midnight, returns 0.  Will return decimal values if not at an exact minute.

Members.Name: GetMoonDirection
Members.Summary: Returns the lookVector (Vector3) of the moon. If this lookVector was used in a CFrame, the Part would face the moon.

Members.Name: GetMoonPhase
Members.Summary: Currently always returns 0.75. MoonPhase cannot be edited.

Members.Name: GetSunDirection
Members.Summary: Returns the lookVector (Vector3) of the sun. If this lookVector was used in a CFrame, the Part would face the moon.

Members.Name: SetMinutesAfterMidnight
Members.Summary: Sets the time to be a certain number of minutes after midnight.  This works with integer and decimal values.

Members.Name: Ambient
Members.Summary: The hue of the global lighting.  Changing this changes the color tint of all objects in the Workspace.

Members.Name: Brightness
Members.Summary: How much global light each Part in the Workspace receives. Standard range is 0 to 1 (0 being little light), but can be increased all the way to 5 (colors start to be appear very different at this value).

Members.Name: ColorShift_Bottom
Members.Summary: The hue of global lighting on the bottom surfaces of an object.

Members.Name: ColorShift_Top
Members.Summary: The hue of global lighting on the top surfaces of an object.

Members.Name: FogColor
Members.Summary: A Color3 value that changes the hue of distance fog.

Members.Name: FogEnd
Members.Summary: The distance at which fog completely blocks your vision. This distance is relative to the camera position. Units are in studs

Members.Name: FogStart
Members.Summary: The distance at which the fog gradient begins. This distance is relative to the camera position. Units are in studs.

Members.Name: GeographicLatitude
Members.Summary: The latitude position the level is placed at. This affects sun position. More info

Members.Name: GlobalShadows
Members.Summary: Flag enabling shadows from sun and moon in the place

Members.Name: OutdoorAmbient
Members.Summary: Effective ambient value for outdoors, effectively shadow color outdoors (requires GlobalShadows enabled)

Members.Name: Outlines
Members.Summary: Flag enabling or disabling outlines on parts and terrain

Members.Name: ShadowColor
Members.Summary: Color the shadows appear as. Shadows are drawn mostly for characters, but depending on the lighting will also show for Parts in the Workspace.  Rendering settings can also affect if shadows are drawn.

Members.Name: TimeOfDay
Members.Summary: A string that represent the current time of day. Time is in 24-hour clock format "XX::YY:ZZ", where X is hour, Y is minute, and Z is seconds.

Members.Name: LightingChanged
Members.Summary: Fired whenever a property of Lighting is changed, or a skybox is added or removed. Skyboxes are of type 'Sky' and should be parented directly to lighting.

Name: Debris
Summary: A service that provides utility in cleaning up objects

Members.Name: addItem
Members.Summary: Use AddItem() instead

Members.Name: AddItem
Members.Summary: Adds an Instance into the debris service that will later be destroyed.  Second argument 'lifetime' is optional and specifies how long (in seconds) to wait before destroying the item. If no time is specified then the item added will automatically be destroyed in 10 seconds.

Members.Name: MaxItems
Members.Summary: Deprecated. No replacement

Members.Name: CameraMode
Members.Summary: An enum that describes how a Player's camera is allowed to behave. More info.

Members.Name: DataReady
Members.Summary: Read-only. If true, this Player's persistent data can be loaded, false otherwise. Info on Data Persistence.

Members.Name: LoadCharacter
Members.Summary: Loads in a new character for this player.  This will replace the player's current character, if they have one. This should be used in conjunction with Players.CharacterAutoLoads to control spawning of characters. This function only works from a server-side script (NOT a LocalScript).

Members.Name: playerFromCharacter
Members.Summary: Use GetPlayerFromCharacter() instead

Members.Name: WaitForDataReady
Members.Summary: Yields until the persistent data for this Player is ready to be loaded. Info on Data Persistence.

Members.Name: Idled
Members.Summary: Fired periodically after the user has been AFK for a while.  Currently this event is only fired for the *local* Player.  "time" is the time in seconds that the user has been idle.

Members.Name: FindPartsInRegion3
Members.Summary: Returns parts in the area defined by the Region3, up to specified maxCount or 100, whichever is less

Members.Name: FindPartsInRegion3WithIgnoreList
Members.Summary: Returns parts in the area defined by the Region3, up to specified maxCount or 100, whichever is less

Members.Name: FindPartOnRay
Members.Summary: Return type is (BasePart, Vector3) if the ray hits.  If it misses it will return (nil, PointAtEndOfRay)

Members.Name: FindPartOnRayWithIgnoreList
Members.Summary: Return type is (BasePart, Vector3) if the ray hits.  If it misses it will return (nil, PointAtEndOfRay)

Name: BasePart
Summary: A structural class, not creatable

Members.Name: Color
Members.Summary: Deprecated. Use BrickColor instead

Members.Name: CFrame
Members.Summary: Contains information regarding the Part's position and a matrix that defines the Part's rotation. Can read/write. More info

Members.Name: CanCollide
Members.Summary: Determines whether physical interactions with other Parts are respected.  If true, will collide and react with physics to other Parts.  If false, other parts will pass thru instead of colliding

Members.Name: Anchored
Members.Summary: Determines whether or not physics acts upon the Part.  If true, part stays 'Anchored' in space, not moving regardless of any collision/forces acting upon it.  If false, physics works normally on the part.

Members.Name: Elasticity
Members.Summary: A float value ranging from 0.0f to 1.0f. Sets how much the Part will rebound against another. a value of 1 is like a superball, and 0 is like a lead block.

Members.Name: Friction
Members.Summary: A float value ranging from 0.0f to 1.0f. Sets how much the Part will be able to slide. a value of 1 is no sliding, and 0 is no friction, so infinite sliding.

Members.Name: Locked
Members.Summary: Determines whether building tools (in-game and studio) can manipulate this Part.  If true, no editing allowed.  If false, editing is allowed.

Members.Name: Material
Members.Summary: Specifies the look and feel the Part should have. Note: this does not define the color the Part is, see BrickColor for that. More info

Members.Name: Reflectance
Members.Summary: Specifies how shiny the Part is. A value of 1 is completely reflective (chrome), while a value of 0 is no reflectance (concrete wall)

Members.Name: ResizeIncrement
Members.Summary: Sets the value for the smallest change in size allowable by the Resize(NormalId, int) function.

Members.Name: ResizeableFaces
Members.Summary: Sets the value for the faces allowed to be resized by the Resize(NormalId, int) function.

Members.Name: Transparency
Members.Summary: Sets how visible an object is. A value of 1 makes the object invisible, while a value of 0 makes the object opaque.

Members.Name: Velocity
Members.Summary: How fast the Part is traveling in studs/second. This property is NOT recommended to be modified directly, unless there is good reason.  Otherwise, try using a BodyForce to move a Part.

Members.Name: makeJoints
Members.Summary: Use MakeJoints() instead

Members.Name: MakeJoints
Members.Summary: Creates the appropriate SurfaceJoints with all parts that are touching this Instance (including internal joints in the Instance, as in a Model). This uses the SurfaceTypes defined on the surfaces of parts to create the appropriate welds. More info

Members.Name: BreakJoints
Members.Summary: Destroys SurfaceJoints with all parts that are touching this Instance (including internal joints in the Instance, as in a Model).

Members.Name: GetMass
Members.Summary: Returns a number that is the mass of this Instance.  Mass of a Part is immutable, and is changed only by the size of the Part.

Members.Name: Resize
Members.Summary: Resizes a Part in the direction of the face defined by 'NormalId', by the amount specified by 'deltaAmount'. If the operation will expand the part to intersect another Instance, the part will not resize at all.  Return true if the call is successful, false otherwise.

Members.Name: getMass
Members.Summary: Use GetMass() instead

Members.Name: LocalSimulationTouched
Members.Summary: Deprecated. Use Touched instead

Members.Name: StoppedTouching
Members.Summary: Deprecated. Use TouchEnded instead

Members.Name: TouchEnded
Members.Summary: Fired when the part stops touching another part

Name: Part
Summary: A plastic building block - the fundamental component of ROBLOX

Name: TrussPart
Summary: An extendable building truss

Name: WedgePart
Summary: A Wedge Part

Name: PrismPart
Summary: A Prism Part

Name: PyramidPart
Summary: A Pyramid Part

Name: ParallelRampPart
Summary: A ParallelRamp Part

Name: RightAngleRampPart
Summary: A RightAngleRamp Part

Name: CornerWedgePart
Summary: A CornerWedge Part

Name: PlayerGui
Summary: A container instance that syncs data between a single player and the server.  ScreenGui objects that are placed in this container will be shown to the Player parent only

Name: GuiMain
Summary: Deprecated, please use ScreenGui

Name: ScreenGui
Summary: The core GUI object on which tools are built.  Add Frames/Labels/Buttons to this object to have them rendered as a 2D overlay

Name: FunctionalTest
Summary: Deprecated. Use TestService instead

Name: BillboardGui
Summary: A GUI that adorns an object in the 3D world.  Add Frames/Labels/Buttons to this object to have them rendered while attached to a 3D object

Members.Name: Adornee
Members.Summary: The Object the billboard gui uses as its base to render from.  Currently, the only way to set this property is thru a script, and must exist in the workspace.  This will only render if the object assigned derives from BasePart.

Members.Name: AbsolutePosition
Members.Summary: A read-only Vector2 value that is the GuiObject's current position (x,y) in pixel space, from the top left corner of the GuiObject.

Members.Name: AbsoluteSize
Members.Summary: A read-only Vector2 value that is the GuiObject's current size (width, height) in pixel space.

Members.Name: Active
Members.Summary: If true, this GuiObject can fire mouse events and will pass them to any GuiObjects layered underneath, while false will do neither.

Members.Name: AlwaysOnTop
Members.Summary: If true, billboard gui does not get occluded by 3D objects, but always renders on the screen.

Members.Name: Enabled
Members.Summary: If true, billboard gui will render, otherwise rendering will be skipped.

Members.Name: ExtentsOffset
Members.Summary: A Vector3 (x,y,z) defined in studs that will offset the gui from the extents of the 3d object it is rendering from.

Members.Name: PlayerToHideFrom
Members.Summary: Specifies a Player that the BillboardGui will not render to.

Members.Name: StudsOffset
Members.Summary: A Vector3 (x,y,z) defined in studs that will offset the gui from the centroid of the 3d object it is rendering from

Members.Name: SizeOffset
Members.Summary: A Vector2 (x,y) defined in studs that will offset the gui size from it's current size.

Members.Name: Size
Members.Summary: A UDim2 value describing the size of the BillboardGui. More information on UDim2 is available here. Relative values are defined as one-to-one with studs.

Members.Name: AbsolutePosition
Members.Summary: A read-only Vector2 value that is the GuiObject's current position (x,y) in pixel space, from the top left corner of the GuiObject.

Members.Name: AbsoluteSize
Members.Summary: A read-only Vector2 value that is the GuiObject's current size (width, height) in pixel space.

Members.Name: TweenPosition
Members.Summary: Smoothly moves a GuiObject from its current position to 'endPosition'. The only required argument is 'endPosition'. More info

Members.Name: TweenSize
Members.Summary: Smoothly translates a GuiObject's current size to 'endSize'. The only required argument is 'endSize'. More info

Members.Name: TweenSizeAndPosition
Members.Summary: Smoothly translates a GuiObject's current size to 'endSize', and also smoothly translates the GuiObject's current position to 'endPosition'. The only required arguments are 'endSize' and 'endPosition'. More info

Members.Name: Active
Members.Summary: If true, this GuiObject can fire mouse events and will pass them to any GuiObjects layered underneath, while false will do neither.

Members.Name: BackgroundColor3
Members.Summary: A Color3 value that specifies the background color for the GuiObject. This value is ignored if the Style property (not found on all GuiObjects) is set to something besides custom.

Members.Name: BackgroundTransparency
Members.Summary: A number value that specifies how transparent the background of the GuiObject is. This value is ignored if the Style property (not found on all GuiObjects) is set to something besides custom.

Members.Name: BorderColor3
Members.Summary: A Color3 value that specifies the color of the outline of the GuiObject. This value is ignored if the Style property (not found on all GuiObjects) is set to something besides custom.

Members.Name: BorderSizePixel
Members.Summary: A number value that specifies the thickness (in pixels) of the outline of the GuiObject. Currently this value can only be set to either 0 or 1, any other number has no effect. This value is ignored if the Style property (not found on all GuiObjects) is set to something besides custom.

Members.Name: ClipsDescendants
Members.Summary: If set to true, any descendants of this GuiObject will only render if contained within it's borders. If set to false, all descendants will render regardless of position.

Members.Name: Draggable
Members.Summary: If true, allows a GuiObject to be dragged by the user's mouse. The events 'DragBegin' and 'DragStopped' are fired when the appropriate action happens, and only will fire on Draggable=true GuiObjects.

Members.Name: Size
Members.Summary: A UDim2 value describing the size of the GuiObject on screen in both absolute and relative coordinates. More information on UDim2 is available here.

Members.Name: Position
Members.Summary: A UDim2 value describing the position of the top-left corner of the GuiObject on screen. More information on UDim2 is available here.

Members.Name: SizeConstraint
Members.Summary: The direction(s) that an object can be resized in. More info.

Members.Name: ZIndex
Members.Summary: Describes the ordering in which overlapping GuiObjects will be drawn. A value of 1 is drawn first, while higher values are drawn in ascending order (each value draws over the last).

Members.Name: BackgroundColor
Members.Summary: Deprecated. Use BackgroundColor3 instead

Members.Name: BorderColor
Members.Summary: Deprecated. Use BorderColor3 instead

Members.Name: DragBegin
Members.Summary: Fired when a GuiObject with Draggable set to true starts to be dragged. 'InitialPosition' is a UDim2 value of the position of the GuiObject before any drag operation began.

Members.Name: DragStopped
Members.Summary: Always fired after a DragBegin event, DragStopped is fired when the user releases the mouse button causing a drag operation on the GuiObject. Arguments 'x', and 'y' specify the top-left absolute position of the GuiObject when the event is fired.

Members.Name: MouseEnter
Members.Summary: Fired when the mouse enters a GuiObject, as long as the GuiObject is active (see active property for more detail). Arguments 'x', and 'y' specify the absolute pixel position of the mouse.

Members.Name: MouseLeave
Members.Summary: Fired when the mouse leaves a GuiObject, as long as the GuiObject is active (see active property for more detail). Arguments 'x', and 'y' specify the absolute pixel position of the mouse.

Members.Name: MouseMoved
Members.Summary: Fired when the mouse is inside a GuiObject and moves, as long as the GuiObject is active (see active property for more detail). Arguments 'x', and 'y' specify the absolute pixel position of the mouse.

Name: Frame
Summary: A container object used to layout other GUI objects

Members.Name: Style
Members.Summary: Determines how a frame will look. Uses Enum.FrameStyle. More info

Name: ImageLabel
Summary: A GUI object containing an Image

Members.Name: Image
Members.Summary: Specifies the id of the texture to display. More info

Name: TextLabel
Summary: A GUI object containing text

Members.Name: TextColor
Members.Summary: Deprecated. Use TextColor3 instead

Name: TextButton
Summary: A GUI button containing text

Members.Name: TextColor
Members.Summary: Deprecated. Use TextColor3 instead

Name: TextBox
Summary: A text entry box

Members.Name: TextColor
Members.Summary: Deprecated. Use TextColor3 instead

Name: GuiButton
Summary: A GUI button containing an Image

Members.Name: AutoButtonColor
Members.Summary: Determines whether a button changes color automatically when reacting to mouse events.

Members.Name: Modal
Members.Summary: Allows the mouse to be free in first person mode. If a button with this property set to true is visible, the mouse is 'free' in first person mode.

Members.Name: Style
Members.Summary: Determines how a button will look, including mouse event states. Uses Enum.ButtonStyle. More info

Members.Name: MouseButton1Click
Members.Summary: Fired when the mouse is over the button, and the mouse down and up events fire without the mouse leaving the button.

Members.Name: MouseButton1Down
Members.Summary: Fired when the mouse button is pushed down on a button.

Members.Name: MouseButton1Up
Members.Summary: Fired when the mouse button is released on a button.

Members.Name: MouseButton2Click
Members.Summary: This function currently does not work :(

Members.Name: MouseButton2Down
Members.Summary: This function currently does not work :(

Members.Name: MouseButton2Up
Members.Summary: This function currently does not work :(

Name: ImageButton
Summary: A GUI button containing an Image

Members.Name: Image
Members.Summary: Specifies the asset id of the texture to display. More info

Name: Handles
Summary: A 3D GUI object to represent draggable handles

Name: ArcHandles
Summary: A 3D GUI object to represent draggable arc handles

Name: SelectionBox
Summary: A 3D GUI object to represent the visible selection around an object

Name: SurfaceSelection
Summary: A 3D GUI object to represent the visible selection around a face of an object

Name: Configuration
Summary: An object that can be placed under parts to hold Value objects that represent that part's configuration

Name: SelectionPartLasso
Summary: A visual line drawn representation between two part objects

Name: SelectionPointLasso
Summary: A visual line drawn representation between two positions

Name: PartPairLasso
Summary: A visual line drawn representation between two parts.

Name: Pose
Summary: The pose of a joint relative to it's parent part in a keyframe

Name: Keyframe
Summary: One keyframe of an animation

Name: Animation
Summary: Represents a linked animation object, containing keyframes and poses.

Name: AnimationTrack
Summary: Returned by a call to LoadAnimation. Controls the playback of an animation on a Humanoid.

Members.Name: Stopped
Members.Summary: This event is never raised

Name: CharacterMesh
Summary: Modifies the appearance of a body part.

Name: Dialog
Summary: An object used to make dialog trees to converse with players

Name: DialogChoice
Summary: An object used to make dialog trees to converse with players

Name: Terrain
Summary: Object representing a high performance bounded grid of static 4x4 parts

Members.Name: GetCell
Members.Summary: Returns CellMaterial, CellBlock, CellOrientation

Members.Name: GetWaterCell
Members.Summary: Returns hasAnyWater, WaterForce, WaterDirection

Name: PointLight
Summary: Makes the parent part emit light in a spherical shape

Name: SpotLight
Summary: Makes the parent part emit light in a conical shape
